data.title: Unique and Different
data.text:
Suggested restaurant for a business dinner with a client.

Restaurant is small and unique,  but doesn't accept reservations,  probably due to size as well as few tables and a small bar.

Decor is different. Place gets very crowded,  thus extremely noisy due to poor acoustic quality.  Difficult to conduct conversation with other people.

Wait staff seemed knowledgeable,  but orders were swapped or forgotten.

Great sounding menu.

Maybe for others. This is definitely the deal, but not my preference.

data.title: Funky and Fabulous
data.text: One must stop at this little gem.  We visited after an event at DPAC for cocktails and dessert.  The bar is amazing - it is super tall and has a rolling library ladder to reach the upper shelves.  It's a super small venue with lots of attitude.  The cocktails were unique and divine - I highly recommend the Perry Mason and the Yellow Card.  We shared the Maple Pumpkin Pot deCreme....Wow!  We were there on a Thursday night and they offered live music which was nice and not too loud.  Well done!

data.title: fabulous bar to catch up with friends
data.text: This bar is a must visit. The cocktails are incredible and the food just as good.  There is often live light jazz music that fills the background while you talk, eat and drink yourself content.

data.title: Top Notch
data.text: The food and beverages at Bar Virgile are tops for Durham, maybe all of NC, actually they could probably compete with Chicago, NYC, DC, and Miami while they're at it.  Trendy drinks, executed by professional bartenders that know their stuff.  The food menu is exceptional.

data.title: Nice ambiance but taste of food...
data.text:
Appreciate the relaxed ambiance, but if a restaurant was typed "tapas," I would expect more than a handful of small plates--- would be happy with at least 20 choices. What they have is typical small restaurant menu, nowhere near to qualify for  "tapas" style. Felt mis-led a bit.  

The bar staff, one with Mohawk hair was sweet but the one with curly hair and beard did not have any smile.  Even though he loosened up only toward the end, would have appreciated more friendly reception.

The food.... Had the fennel cured pork, great presentation with the cured pork but the mustard was too over-powering for a subtle tasting pork.  The apple sauce was nice but still does not go well with the pork.  I tried to pair different things to see if it worked but got pretty bored.  The whole dish just does not work.  

The lamb sausage is spicy but not much more than that, no other depth to the flavor.  When paired with the hummus or the rest of the vegetables (zucchini and a couple of others)--- completely tasteless.  

For the foodies out there, this is not the place for enjoying quality or creative flood.

data.title: The garganelli won my heart...
data.text: We met another couple for dinner here, based on the strong reviews it has received. It seemed just fine, but initially nothing out of the ordinary for a very good restaurant. [Sorry it that sounds blasé or like a put-down; it isn't, as you'll see.] The other couple thought it was the best dinner of their week in Raleigh-Durham, ordering some marinated olives and steaks. My wife got a Tandoori chicken that was good but not up to recent London Indian food; sort of a regional take on it instead. However, I got intrigued by their peach+tomato version of Insalata Caprese, and the garganelli with Pecorino romano cheese  and fennel sausage won me over completely.

data.title: Fabulous first visit
data.text: After reading reviews here, we decided to walk over after a matinee show at DPAC for an early dinner. We were greeted, seated in a friendly manner. The food was simply excellent ... Unbelievable flavor combinations that were subtle yet zesty. Do not miss their version of German chocolate cake ... Worth every calorie.

data.title: Expert bar tenders, superb food
data.text: One pleasure here, sitting at the bar, is watching truly expert bartenders at work--and what a range of ryes, bourbon, gins, etc., they have to work with. Then the pasta dish I had was perfect, evoking the best of Italy. No reservations here, and the space is small, but arriving at 5:30 on a Saturday night got us to the DPAC for a 7:00 o'clock curtain. The wait for tables started a bit after six.

data.title: Out of this world Amazing Food
data.text: Everything was amazing at this restaurant. The charcuterie platter, the fries, the fried calamari and oysters were amazing! Perfect for date night! Cannot wait to go back!!

data.title: Great date night spot!
data.text: My husband and I love trying new restaurants.  We are exploring more of Durham and found this restaurant on yelp- The reviews I had read sounded wonderful.  We went on a Saturday night and got a seat at the bar (our fav)  Its a small restaurant but with a great atmosphere and feeling to it.  Our bartenders were fabulous!! We tried a few different craft cocktails and loved everyone.  I started with the honey bee sour that was made with egg whites- never gone that route before but so glad I did.  It was delicious! Our food was better than the reviews made it sound.  We will definitely make Bar Virgile a regular date night spot!

data.title: The coolest vibe in Durham
data.text: What a fabulous bar/lounge atmosphere with amazing food & cocktails and the live music was even more amazing!  Although a small place, the live music wasn't too loud.  Conversation with my friends was so enjoyable Because the music was just the right volume.

data.title: What a cocktail!
data.text: The building has been beautifully renovated, the food was good and the drinks great. Can't wait to try something different from the food and drinks menu

data.title: Great Bar and Restaurant
data.text: Excellent, all around. Outstanding Bartenders and great Vibe. A+ Charcuterie and Cheese is a good way to start, but they offer a fairly diverse menu for such a small place.

data.title: Wow
data.text:
Wow! Dang . . . I mean a super, duper wow! It's a little place in a nondescript location with barely more than a half dozen tables and it is batting elk above its average. (Sorry, I had to use a baseball analogy, it is Durham, NC.)

The food is just awesome. From the wide selection of cured meats to the great cheese pairings. We had a bunch of small plate appetizers and split the duck confit. It wa delightful. Super savory and very complex in flavors and textures.

This is squarely a mixologists bar - and they pride themselves on the diverse drinks. We went for the beer and wine menu - but I've got a bit of dinners remorse that I didn't try one of their curated libations. 

Take home: an awesome evening. Great food. Delightful service! I'll be back for sure!!

data.title: Stellar burgers, fun cocktail selection
data.text: Immediately impressed at the fun vibe in this place. It's small, but the atmosphere is really nice and intimate but not too serious. Food is stellar. We settled for the burgers, a mix with short rib - hard to even describe how much flavor these had. Fries were thin and crispy, seasoned well. Cocktail selection was fun and extremely unique - check out the jalapeno margarita type drink, or the cinnamon/strawberry swizzle. Service was good and prompt. Will definitely be back!

data.title: Awesome food!
data.text: what a GREAT little place! Fantastic vibe, great great great food! Will definitely be coming back! I had the duck and it was over the top!

data.title: Lot of Fun
data.text: The food is amazing and the liquor selection is high quality. I always sit at the bar, but the service can be hit and miss. They don't always do great when they're really busy, but the food and drinks are so good it doesn't matter.

data.title: Consistent quality and superb service
data.text: We visited Bar Virgile for the second time and it was another excellent evening of cocktails and appetizers at the bar. We were well looked after by Doug at the bar and enjoyed our cocktails along with our fried oyster and brussel sprout appetizers - both were flavorful and light. Of special note this visit was the superb guest management efforts by Cailey in greeting and maintaining a positive atmosphere on a very crowded Saturday night. Kudos to the whole Bar Virgile team for another job well done!

data.title: OMG. really, bacon(sugared) in my manhattan????
data.text: There is no reason to doubt why they are in the top 100 bars in america! drinks were amazing as was service. food was very good also. fried oysters, blue cheese, cured pork. love the staff and location is so close to the DPAC.

data.title: Wow
data.text: Loved it. Tiny bar area. Also some other seating for food, but we sat the bar. Small and intimate. Friendly and helpful bartender. From the winter cocktail menu, had the bacon-infused Ol' Fashioned. Truly outstanding. Lots of good flavor and some heat at the end. It opens at 4 p.m. on a Saturday. We arrived at 4:05 p.m., and already a handful of folks were dribbling in. Go early.
